title: Arturo Vidal is having a Barcelona revival thanks to their ever-changing midfield
text:
The sacred cows of Barcelona’s midfield are no longer untouchable and it seems Arturo Vidal stands to gain most from the change.

‘We have a lot of midfielders and he gives us that arrival in to the box,’ said the Barcelona coach after Sunday’s game against Sevilla. It was Vidal’s first start and he scored – doing exactly that: arriving in the box – to score the second goal in the 4-0 win.

When he was taken off in the second period he received an ovation that never would have happened a year earlier. His road to acceptance at Barcelona has been a long one.

Arturo Vidal is enjoying a renaissance at Barcelona in the early stages of the 2019-20 season

Vidal produced a starring display as Barcelona defeated Sevilla 4-0 on Sunday in La Liga

A year ago, Vidal looked like he was cast out on the fringes of the squad by Barcelona

ARTURO VIDAL STATS THIS SEASON Appearances: 6 Goals: 2 Assists: 1

In October last year he was left on the bench for the game against Tottenham in the Champions League. He didn’t like being dropped and he didn’t like being brought on for just four minutes at the end of the game either. After the match he took to Instagram to show his displeasure with an angry-face Emoji.

That sort of flippancy doesn’t usually end well at Barcelona, or at Real Madrid – memories come to mind of Kaka’s wife tweeting on his behalf to complain that he was not being picked.

Vidal already had it tough because he had been pigeon-holed as the bruising midfield enforcer that the team might need from time to time when plan A – playing the Barca way – was not working.

The Robert Di Niro Taxi Driver appearance and those stories from the past had already made him out to be someone who might not fit in the long term at the Camp Nou.

In 2015 he crashed his Ferrari on his way to a casino. According to local media he was over the alcohol limit and all while on Copa America duty for Chile. It had not been the first time he had not been the model pro off the pitch so how would he fit in at Barcelona?

Vidal shared a picture of an angry emoji when benched in the Champions League last year

But now, in an ever-changing Barcelona midfield, Vidal appears to be making a big difference

At the Nou Camp, Sergio Busquets and Ivan Rakitic have been two-thirds of a Barcelona midfield that since 2015 has won a treble and three leagues. But Rakitic is a player they are desperate to sell because he still commands a good price.

And the plan is to protect Busquets from the sort of burnout that has often taken something away from the last month of his season. Vidal didn’t just score at the weekend he also turned around Barcelona's Champions League meeting with Inter a few days before.

At half-time Barca were losing 1-0 and playing badly. Coach Valverde flipped his midfield triangle taking off Busquets and, with Frenkie de Jong and Arthur Melo now at the base he put Vidal at the apex.

Suddenly Inter Milan’s three centre-backs, having completely bossed Luis Suarez in the first half, had something a little more taxing to think of. With Vidal and Suarez troubling them there was less manpower to deal with Lionel Messi’s wanderings.

Vidal helped Barcelona come from behind to defeat Inter Milan in the Champions League

Vidal has scored two goals in six games so far, including one strike against Real Betis

Vidal now has the foundations in place to kick on and play a key role for Barcelona this season

He sauntered through the Inter back line and set-up Suarez for what was the winning goal. For once, Valverde had changed a game with his substitutions and Vidal was the player he had used to do it.

That applause as he went off on Sunday after another important contribution seemed to signal a sea-change in opinion. Barcelona supporters have remembered that Vidal’s eight league titles have been as much about his intelligence as a player, as about his physical attributes.

Barcelona have overbooking in midfield this season but far from pushing Vidal out of the door it seems to have made him more important in Valverde’s ever-changing midfield.
description: PETE JENSON IN SPAIN: The sacred cows of Barcelona's midfield are no longer untouchable and it seems Arturo Vidal stands to gain most from the change.
